TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AmbientProperties extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides ambient property values to top-level controls.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An ambient property is a property on a control that, if not set, is retrieved from the parent control. If the control does not have a parent and the property is not set, the control tries to find the value of the ambient property through the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component.Site%2A> property. If the control is not sited, the site does not support ambient properties, or the property is not set on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AmbientProperties> object, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> uses its own default values. Some objects derived from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class might set the property even if you do not. For example, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> class always sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ForeColor%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> properties.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient background color of an object.
Docs.value: A value that represents the background color of an object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If there is no ambient background color, the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.BackColor%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Empty?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient cursor of an object.
Docs.value: A that represents the cursor of an object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If there is no ambient cursor, the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Cursor%2A> property is `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient font of an object.
Docs.value: A that represents the font used when displaying text within an object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If there is no ambient font, the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Font%2A> property is `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ambient foreground color of an object.
